chargeHist.descr: Injury by Use of Vehicle with PAC

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC>=0.15) and Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st)(PAC>=0.15). The defendant was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC>=0.15) and the other charge, Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st)(PAC>=0.15) was dismissed by the court.

  • Scott R Albrecht was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC>=0.15), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from DOC Admissions Registrar Kathryn Galarowicz, Madison office requesting a clarification or amendment of/to the JOC
Ct 1:  OWI Causing Injury -1st with BAC > .15;  Ct 2:  OWI causing injury 1st BAC > 15.

Defendant Scott R Albrecht in court with attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Amended Information filed.  Reading waived.  Ct 1 amended to misdeameanor. Rights/elements.  On Count 1, no contest plea entered.   Dismiss Ct 2.  Sentence withheld 2 years probation.  Conditions:  Fine $1179 plus $200 DNA surcharge.  12 months revocation, 12 month interlock, AODA and comply.  May transfer under Interstate Compact Regulations to Minnesota for probation.  Defendant must report to Columbia County probation by 4 pm today.  $500 bond posted to be applied. Jail credit 2 days. Request for expungment or amend to 1st offense denied.  11:02/11:16 pm.
Defendant Scott R Albrecht in court with attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed by defendant/counsel.

Plea/sentencing hearing on January 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Scott R Albrecht in court with attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant stood mute, Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
